required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Anti Mullerian Hormone for Ovarian Reserve Determination of Preoperative and Postoperative Endometrioma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Anti Mullerian Hormone for Ovarian Reserve Determination of Preoperative and Postoperative Endometrioma Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research

brief_summary.textblock: Ovarian reserve influenced by many factor but especially cysts like endometrioma. Anti mullerian hormone is recent marker for ovarian reserve. The investigators are searching ovarian reserve pre and post operatively by using antimullerian hormone of endometrioma patient who are operated for their cysts.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Long term postoperative ovarian reserve outcomes of endometrioma patients by examining antimullerian hormone.

biospec_descr.textblock: We are collecting serum samples of pre and post operative endometroma patients and measuring anti m√ºllerian hormone levels.

study_pop.textblock: Females who are administring gynecology clinic suffering from symptomatic benign ovarian cysts.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ultrasonographical symptomatic and benign cysts which has surgery indication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Over 42 years old, systemic endocrine disorder, history of ovarian surgery

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Education and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research
